The trading window for designated persons and their immediate relatives was closed from April 1, 2025, to May 24, 2025. This closure was implemented as per the company's code of conduct to regulate, monitor, and report trading by designated individuals.

The closure of the trading window was also related to the forthcoming announcement of the company's audited financial results, potentially including a dividend declaration, which was under consideration by the Board of Directors.

A significant tariff revision by the HP grid took effect on May 1, 2025. The regulated tariff was set at ₹18.1 per mmbtu (GCV), a 47% reduction from the previous rate of ₹34 per mmbtu.

Gujarat State Petronet Ltd (GSPL) had sought a higher tariff of ₹50.8 per mmbtu. The substantial reduction in the tariff was a major negative surprise.

Following the tariff revision, Prabhudas Lilladhar downgraded GSPL to "REDUCE" from "Buy" on August 13, 2025, setting a price target of ₹348.0.

The Board of Directors recommended a dividend of ₹5 per equity share of ₹10 each for FY 2024-25, subject to shareholder approval.

Shri Ajith Kumar T.R., the Chief Financial Officer and Key Managerial personnel of GSPL, was relieved from his duties effective May 31, 2025, upon his superannuation.

Gujarat Gas announced its Q4 FY25 and Annual FY25 results on August 9, 2025. The company reported a revenue from operations of ₹4,289 crore for the quarter ended March 31, 2025. The EBITDA for the quarter was ₹524 crore, and the standalone profit before tax was ₹388 crore.

Q1 FY26 results were announced on August 13, 2025, with revenue at ₹4402.03 crore, net profit at ₹464.85 crore, and EBITDA at ₹822.88 crore.

Gujarat Gas achieved its highest ever CNG volume of 3.22 mmscmd in Q4 FY25, a 12% increase compared to Q4 FY24.
